pullRequest.title: vmconstantpool updates for supporting OpenJDK MethodHandles
pullRequest.bodyText:
In order to support OpenJDK MethodHandles, the below mentioned class,
field and static method references are introduced in vmconstantpool.xml.
Class references:

java/lang/invoke/MemberName (j.l.i.MemberName)
j.l.i.MethodType
j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper
j.l.i.MethodTypeForm
j.l.i.LambdaForm
j.l.i.MethodHandle
j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper
j.l.i.WrongMethodTypeException

Field references:

From j.l.i.MemberName,

name="clazz" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
name="name" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"
name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"
name="flags" signature="I"
name="resolution" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"


From j.l.i.MethodType,

name="ptypes" signature="[Ljava/lang/Class;"
name="rtype" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodTypeForm;"
name="methodDescriptor" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"


From j.l.i.MethodTypeForm,

[JDK14+]  name="parameterSlotCount" signature="S"
[JDK8-11] name="argCounts" signature="J"
"parameterSlotCount" is an alias for "argCounts"


From j.l.i.LambdaForm,

name="vmentry" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MemberName;"


From j.l.i.MethodHandle,

name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/LambdaForm;"
name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;"



Static method references:

From j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper,

name="vmResolveFromMethodDescriptorString"


From j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper.

name="sendResolveMethodHandle"
name="resolveMethodHandle"
name="resolveInvokeDynamic"
name="resolveConstantDynamic"
name="constructorPlaceHolder"



These new additions are only enabled if the opt_openjdkMethodhandle flag
is specified. Currently, this flag is disabled.
Co-authored-by: Jack Lu Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh sbabneet@ca.ibm.com

beforeCommit.message:
vmconstantpool updates for supporting OpenJDK MethodHandles

In order to support OpenJDK MethodHandles, the following class, field
and static method references are introduced in vmconstantpool.xml:

Class references:
1. java/lang/invoke/MemberName (j.l.i.MemberName)
2. j.l.i.MethodType
3. j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper
4. j.l.i.MethodTypeForm
5. j.l.i.LambdaForm
6. j.l.i.MethodHandle
7. j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper
8. j.l.i.WrongMethodTypeException

Field references:
1. From j.l.i.MemberName,
   - name="clazz" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="name" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"
   - name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"
   - name="flags" signature="I"
   - name="resolution" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"
2. From j.l.i.MethodType,
   - name="ptypes" signature="[Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="rtype" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodTypeForm;"
   - name="methodDescriptor" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"
3. From j.l.i.MethodTypeForm,
   - [JDK14+]  name="parameterSlotCount" signature="S"
   - [JDK8-11] name="argCounts" signature="J"
   - "parameterSlotCount" is an alias for "argCounts"
4. From j.l.i.LambdaForm,
   - name="vmentry" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MemberName;"
5. From j.l.i.MethodHandle,
   - name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/LambdaForm;"
   - name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;"

Static method references:
1. From j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper,
   - name="vmResolveFromMethodDescriptorString"
2. From j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper.
   - name="sendResolveMethodHandle"
   - name="resolveMethodHandle"
   - name="resolveInvokeDynamic"
   - name="resolveConstantDynamic"
   - name="constructorPlaceHolder"

These new additions are only enabled if the opt_openjdkMethodhandle flag
is specified. Currently, this flag is disabled.

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

3. From j.l.i.MethodTypeForm,
   - [JDK14+]  name="parameterSlotCount" signature="S"

   - "parameterSlotCount" is an alias for "argCounts"
4. From j.l.i.LambdaForm,
   - name="vmentry" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MemberName;"

nodes.bodyText:
Another alternative is to add an opt_methodHandleCommon flag that is required by both opt_methodHandle and opt_openjdkMethodhandle.
This comment can be moved to the description of that flag and it makes it clear (and enforced) the dependency between them
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -340,6 +348,30 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti
 
 	<fieldref class="com/ibm/oti/util/WeakReferenceNode" name="next" signature="Lcom/ibm/oti/util/WeakReferenceNode;" flags="opt_methodHandle"/>
 
+	<!-- OpenJDK MethodHandles: field references. -->
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MemberName" name="clazz" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MemberName" name="name" signature="Ljava/lang/String;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MemberName" name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MemberName" name="flags" signature="I" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MemberName" name="resolution" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodType" name="ptypes" signature="[Ljava/lang/Class;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodType" name="rtype" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodType" name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodTypeForm;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodTypeForm" name="parameterSlotCount" signature="S" versions="14-" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle">
+		<fieldalias name="argCounts" signature="J" versions="8-11"  flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	</fieldref>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/LambdaForm" name="vmentry" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MemberName;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodHandle" name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/LambdaForm;" flags="opt_openjdkMethodhandle"/>
+		
+	<!--
+	Field references used by both OpenJ9 and OpenJDK MethodHandles are mentioned below.
+	Multiple flags or multiple definitions under different flags are unsupported for field references.
+	So, the below field references are defined without a flag field.
+	These field references are only needed for opt_methodHandle and opt_openjdkMethodhandle flags.
+	-->
+	<fieldref class="java/lang/invoke/MethodType" name="methodDescriptor" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"/>

beforeCommit.message:
vmconstantpool updates for supporting OpenJDK MethodHandles

In order to support OpenJDK MethodHandles, the below mentioned class,
field and static method references are introduced in vmconstantpool.xml.

Class references:
1. java/lang/invoke/MemberName (j.l.i.MemberName)
2. j.l.i.MethodType
3. j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper
4. j.l.i.MethodTypeForm
5. j.l.i.LambdaForm
6. j.l.i.MethodHandle
7. j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper
8. j.l.i.WrongMethodTypeException

Field references:
1. From j.l.i.MemberName,
   - name="clazz" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="name" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"
   - name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"
   - name="flags" signature="I"
   - name="resolution" signature="Ljava/lang/Object;"
2. From j.l.i.MethodType,
   - name="ptypes" signature="[Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="rtype" signature="Ljava/lang/Class;"
   - name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodTypeForm;"
   - name="methodDescriptor" signature="Ljava/lang/String;"
3. From j.l.i.MethodTypeForm,
   - [JDK14+]  name="parameterSlotCount" signature="S"
   - [JDK8-11] name="argCounts" signature="J"
   - "parameterSlotCount" is an alias for "argCounts"
4. From j.l.i.LambdaForm,
   - name="vmentry" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MemberName;"
5. From j.l.i.MethodHandle,
   - name="form" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/LambdaForm;"
   - name="type" signature="Ljava/lang/invoke/MethodType;"

Static method references:
1. From j.l.i.MethodTypeHelper,
   - name="vmResolveFromMethodDescriptorString"
2. From j.l.i.MethodHandleHelper.
   - name="sendResolveMethodHandle"
   - name="resolveMethodHandle"
   - name="resolveInvokeDynamic"
   - name="resolveConstantDynamic"
   - name="constructorPlaceHolder"

These new additions are only enabled if the opt_openjdkMethodhandle flag
is specified. Currently, this flag is disabled.

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

commit.message:
Add a flag named J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE_COMMON

J9VM_OPT_METHOD_HANDLE_COMMON enables common dependencies between OpenJ9
and OpenJDK MethodHandles.

Co-authored-by: Jack Lu <Jack.S.Lu@ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Disable OpenJ9 dependencies not needed to support OpenJDK MethodHandles

These dependencies are disabled by using the opt_methodHandle flag.

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Disable OpenJ9 dependencies not needed to support OpenJDK MethodHandles

These dependencies are disabled by using the opt_methodHandle flag.

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
